Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2012 10:38PM scared2death2 wrote: Hi Karensimone, I had a bmx on September 27 and know exactly how you are feeling.  I hate looking at myself.  Oddly enough, I thought I'd be okay and wouldn't look until I had some plan for reconstruction.  As you probably know, it is impossible not to look.  I don't know what I was thinking. I was just fitted today for my first bra and prothetic.  I feel like an old lady and I'm 51 and single (which makes this worse).  I never wore a bra that was so damn high cut.  They are so high maintenance as well.  Placing them in 'containers' every night before bed.  UGH I can't accessorize either.  However, several weeks ago I saw a woman wearing a plain white t-shirt with a pretty scarf.  I would have never though of wearing a scarf with a t-shirt but it looked really nice.

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2012 12:37AM scared2death2 wrote: I had to make an appointment too but was told that I would have to be fitted for the proper prothetic and at the time it made sense.  However, I really think that I should have had a choice.  I believe I was given the most expensive prothetic that the store carried.  At $325 each, that is really high.  The bras were only $25 dollars each which is probably the most inexpensive bra I've ever purchased.  However, even with those, she was pushing for a certain style that I wasn't thrilled with.  The person that helped me was the store owner....I believe.  I'm certainly going to mention it to my doctor.  It is just weird that you can go into any Victoria's Secret with men surrounding you (which I used to hate) and look at more than just bras.  Yet when it comes to mastectomy bras, everything is kept under wraps.  No pun intended.  Hell, besides looking like an old lady bra, no one would know they are mastectomy bras.  UGH
Posts.Title: Just need advice on bras and prothetics scared2death2 Sassa

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2012 10:05PM scared2death2 wrote: Thanks to all who replied to my 'bra fitting' experience.  After much thought about this, my belief is that the breast form she sold me will not fit into most of the pretty bras.  I don't know for sure as I haven't been able to try any of them on yet but I do know for sure the cups aren't as big as the cups in the bras I was sold.  My breast forms are very large...not size as they are just an A cup but they cover the entire chest area.  I also will not be able to wear these in the summer with a sleeveless top because they stick out of the bra slightly under the arm.  I do believe she wanted to sell me the most expensive breast form the store carried.  If I want to wear a pretty bra, I'll have to purchase a different breast form.  I'm very disheartened after going through this that I'm not the only one that has experienced this while being fitted for a mastectomy bra.  It seems like everyone wants to take advantage of your misfortune by cashing in! I asked for my prescription back as well or even a copy.  She told me that when I was ready for more bras, I should come back there as she would hold onto my prescription.  I thought, OH NO I WON'T.  I see my surgeon in a few weeks and will tell her when I'm due for more bras, I want another prescription so I can take my business somewhere else.  Thanks for your replies.
